meanings.definition: To move or transfer (troops or equipment) to a new position.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were redeployed to the northern border for a new mission.
meanings.sent2: After completing their training, the troops were redeployed to a different base.
meanings.sent3: The tanks were redeployed to the playground for the children to play with.
meanings.sent4: The chess pieces were redeployed on the board, changing the course of the game.
meanings.sent5: The colorful toy blocks were redeployed into a new pattern by the child.

meanings.definition: To assign to a new position or task.
meanings.sent1: The manager redeployed the employee to the sales department.
meanings.sent2: She was redeployed to work on a special project with the marketing team.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly redeployed the spatula to flip pancakes with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was redeployed to solve the puzzle in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The artist redeployed her paintbrush to create a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The general decided to redeploy the troops after receiving new orders.
meanings.sent2: The software developer redeployed the application with updated features.
meanings.sent3: The magician redeployed the disappearing trick to amaze the audience.
meanings.sent4: The teacher redeployed the lesson plan for better student engagement.
meanings.sent5: The gardener redeployed the plants to create a more harmonious garden layout.
